article.title: Special Operations Networking Contract Increased to $490 Million
article.author: George Seffers
article.text: iGov Technologies, Reston, Virginia, is the current contractor for the U.S. Special Operations Command Tactical Local Area Network (TACLAN) contract providing TACLAN family of system acquisition, design, integration, production, and delivery in support of special operations forces mission requirements. The TACLAN contract maximum is increased from $470 million to $490 million. U.S. Special Operations Command, MacDill Air Force Base, Florida, is the contracting activity.
